intro: Roldana candicans, commonly known as the showy roldana, is a flowering plant native to the Andes mountains of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces showy, yellow-orange inflorescences that are particularly striking in full sun. Roldana candicans typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils at high altitudes. Its botanical features make it a popular subject for horticultural study and landscape design.
